metadata.description: Name of the environment which is used to generate a short unique hash used in all resources.
Primary location for all resources

metadata.name: Azd Azure Monitoring
metadata.description:
Creates an Application Insights instance and a Log Analytics workspace.

**Note:** This module is not intended for broad, generic use, as it was designed to cater for the requirements of the AZD CLI product. Feature requests and bug fix requests are welcome if they support the development of the AZD CLI but may not be incorporated if they aim to make this module more generic than what it needs to be for its primary use case.
Required. The resource operational insights workspaces name.
Required. The resource insights components name.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The resource portal dashboards name.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Tags of the resource.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspaces
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.
Optional. Instead of using an external reference, use the deployed instance as the target for its diagnostic settings. If set to `true`, the `workspaceResourceId` property is ignored.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. Name of the Log Analytics workspace.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The name of the SKU.
Optional. The capacity reservation level in GB for this workspace, when CapacityReservation sku is selected. Must be in increments of 100 between 100 and 5000.
Optional. List of storage accounts to be read by the workspace.
Optional. List of services to be linked.
Conditional. List of Storage Accounts to be linked. Required if 'forceCmkForQuery' is set to 'true' and 'savedSearches' is not empty.
Optional. Kusto Query Language searches to save.
Optional. LAW data export instances to be deployed.
Optional. LAW data sources to configure.
Optional. LAW custom tables to be deployed.
Optional. List of gallerySolutions to be created in the log analytics workspace.
Optional. Number of days data will be retained for.
Optional. The workspace daily quota for ingestion.
Optional. The network access type for accessing Log Analytics ingestion.
Optional. The network access type for accessing Log Analytics query.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource. Only one type of identity is supported: system-assigned or user-assigned, but not both.
Optional. Set to 'true' to use resource or workspace permissions and 'false' (or leave empty) to require workspace permissions.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Indicates whether customer managed storage is mandatory for query management.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Storage Insight Configs
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Storage Insight Config.
Conditional. The name of the parent Log Analytics workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The name of the storage insights config.
Required. The Azure Resource Manager ID of the storage account resource.
Optional. The names of the blob containers that the workspace should read.
Optional. The names of the Azure tables that the workspace should read.
Optional. Tags to configure in the resource.
The resource ID of the deployed storage insights configuration.
The resource group where the storage insight configuration is deployed.
The name of the storage insights configuration.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Linked Services
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Linked Service.
Conditional. The name of the parent Log Analytics workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the link.
Required. The resource ID of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require read access.
Optional. The resource ID of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require write access.
Optional. Tags to configure in the resource.
The name of the deployed linked service.
The resource ID of the deployed linked service.
The resource group where the linked service is deployed.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Linked Storage Accounts
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Linked Storage Account.
Conditional. The name of the parent Log Analytics workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the link.
Required. The resource ID of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require read access.
The name of the deployed linked storage account.
The resource ID of the deployed linked storage account.
The resource group where the linked storage account is deployed.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Saved Searches
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Saved Search.
Conditional. The name of the parent Log Analytics workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the saved search.
Required. Display name for the search.
Required. Query category.
Required. Kusto Query to be stored.
Optional. Tags to configure in the resource.
Optional. The function alias if query serves as a function.

Optional. The optional function parameters if query serves as a function. Value should be in the following format: "param-name1:type1 = default_value1, param-name2:type2 = default_value2". For more examples and proper syntax please refer to /azure/kusto/query/functions/user-defined-functions.
Optional. The version number of the query language.
Optional. The ETag of the saved search. To override an existing saved search, use "*" or specify the current Etag.
The resource ID of the deployed saved search.
The resource group where the saved search is deployed.
The name of the deployed saved search.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Data Exports
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Data Export.
Required. The data export rule name.
Conditional. The name of the parent workspaces. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Destination properties.
Optional. Active when enabled.
Optional. An array of tables to export, for example: ['Heartbeat', 'SecurityEvent'].
The name of the data export.
The resource ID of the data export.
The name of the resource group the data export was created in.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Datasources
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Data Source.
Conditional. The name of the parent Log Analytics workspace. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the solution.
Required. The kind of the DataSource.
Optional. Tags to configure in the resource.
Optional. Resource ID of the resource to be linked.
Optional. Windows event log name to configure when kind is WindowsEvent.
Optional. Windows event types to configure when kind is WindowsEvent.
Optional. Name of the object to configure when kind is WindowsPerformanceCounter or LinuxPerformanceObject.
Optional. Name of the instance to configure when kind is WindowsPerformanceCounter or LinuxPerformanceObject.
Optional. Interval in seconds to configure when kind is WindowsPerformanceCounter or LinuxPerformanceObject.
Optional. List of counters to configure when the kind is LinuxPerformanceObject.
Optional. Counter name to configure when kind is WindowsPerformanceCounter.
Optional. State to configure when kind is IISLogs or LinuxSyslogCollection or LinuxPerformanceCollection.
Optional. System log to configure when kind is LinuxSyslog.
Optional. Severities to configure when kind is LinuxSyslog.
The resource ID of the deployed data source.
The resource group where the data source is deployed.
The name of the deployed data source.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspace Tables
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace Table.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Required. The name of the table.
Conditional. The name of the parent workspaces. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. Instruct the system how to handle and charge the logs ingested to this table.
Optional. Restore parameters.
Optional. The table retention in days, between 4 and 730. Setting this property to -1 will default to the workspace retention.
Optional. Table's schema.
Optional. Parameters of the search job that initiated this table.
Optional. The table total retention in days, between 4 and 2555. Setting this property to -1 will default to table retention.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
The name of the table.
The resource ID of the table.
The name of the resource group the table was created in.

metadata.name: Operations Management Solutions
metadata.description: This module deploys an Operations Management Solution.
Required. Name of the solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution the target solution resource name will be composed as `{name}({logAnalyticsWorkspaceName})`.
Required. Name of the Log Analytics workspace where the solution will be deployed/enabled.
Optional. Location for all resources.

Optional. The product of the deployed solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution it should be `OMSGallery` and the target solution resource product will be composed as `OMSGallery/{name}`. For third party solution, it can be anything. This is case sensitive.
Optional. The publisher name of the deployed solution. For Microsoft published gallery solution, it is `Microsoft`.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
The name of the deployed solution.
The resource ID of the deployed solution.
The resource group where the solution is deployed.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The resource ID of the deployed log analytics workspace.
The resource group of the deployed log analytics workspace.
The name of the deployed log analytics workspace.
The ID associated with the workspace.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.

metadata.name: Application Insights Components
metadata.description:
Creates an Application Insights instance based on an existing Log Analytics workspace.

**Note:** This module is not intended for broad, generic use, as it was designed to cater for the requirements of the AZD CLI product. Feature requests and bug fix requests are welcome if they support the development of the AZD CLI but may not be incorporated if they aim to make this module more generic than what it needs to be for its primary use case.
Required. The resource insights components name.
Optional. The resource portal dashboards name.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Required. The resource ID of the loganalytics workspace.

Optional. The kind of application that this component refers to, used to customize UI. This value is a freeform string, values should typically be one of the following: web, ios, other, store, java, phone.
Optional. Application type.
Optional. Tags of the resource.

metadata.name: Application Insights
metadata.description: This component deploys an Application Insights instance.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Required. Name of the Application Insights.
Optional. Application type.

Required. Resource ID of the log analytics workspace which the data will be ingested to. This property is required to create an application with this API version. Applications from older versions will not have this property.
Optional. Disable IP masking. Default value is set to true.
Optional. Disable Non-AAD based Auth. Default value is set to false.
Optional. Force users to create their own storage account for profiler and debugger.
Optional. Linked storage account resource ID.
Optional. The network access type for accessing Application Insights ingestion. - Enabled or Disabled.
Optional. The network access type for accessing Application Insights query. - Enabled or Disabled.
Optional. Retention period in days.
Optional. Percentage of the data produced by the application being monitored that is being sampled for Application Insights telemetry.

metadata.name: avm/ptn/azd/container-apps-stack
metadata.description:
Creates an Azure Container Registry and an Azure Container Apps environment.

**Note:** This module is not intended for broad, generic use, as it was designed to cater for the requirements of the AZD CLI product. Feature requests and bug fix requests are welcome if they support the development of the AZD CLI but may not be incorporated if they aim to make this module more generic than what it needs to be for its primary use case
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Required. Name of the Container Apps Managed Environment.
Required. Name of the Azure Container Registry.
Optional. Name of the Azure Container Registry Resource Group.
Optional. Enable admin user that have push / pull permission to the registry.

Required. Existing Log Analytics Workspace resource ID. Note: This value is not required as per the resource type. However, not providing it currently causes an issue that is tracked [here](https://github.com/Azure/bicep/issues/9990).
Optional. Application Insights connection string.
Optional. Azure Monitor instrumentation key used by Dapr to export Service to Service communication telemetry.
Optional. SKU settings. Default is "Standard".
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Zone redundancy setting.

Conditional. CIDR notation IP range assigned to the Docker bridge, network. It must not overlap with any other provided IP ranges and can only be used when the environment is deployed into a virtual network. If not provided, it will be set with a default value by the platform. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.

Conditional. Resource ID of a subnet for infrastructure components. This is used to deploy the environment into a virtual network. Must not overlap with any other provided IP ranges. Required if "internal" is set to true. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.

Conditional. Boolean indicating the environment only has an internal load balancer. These environments do not have a public static IP resource. If set to true, then "infrastructureSubnetId" must be provided. Required if 'zoneRedundant' is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.

Conditional. IP range in CIDR notation that can be reserved for environment infrastructure IP addresses. It must not overlap with any other provided IP ranges and can only be used when the environment is deployed into a virtual network. If not provided, it will be set with a default value by the platform. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true  to make the resource WAF compliant.

Conditional. An IP address from the IP range defined by "platformReservedCidr" that will be reserved for the internal DNS server. It must not be the first address in the range and can only be used when the environment is deployed into a virtual network. If not provided, it will be set with a default value by the platform. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.
Conditional. Workload profiles configured for the Managed Environment. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.
Optional. Name of the infrastructure resource group. If not provided, it will be set with a default value. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.

metadata.name: App ManagedEnvironments
metadata.description: This module deploys an App Managed Environment (also known as a Container App Environment).
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Required. Access mode for storage: "ReadOnly" or "ReadWrite".
Required. Type of storage: "SMB" or "NFS".
Required. Storage account name.
Required. File share name.
Required. Name of the Container Apps Managed Environment.

Required. Existing Log Analytics Workspace resource ID. Note: This value is not required as per the resource type. However, not providing it currently causes an issue that is tracked [here](https://github.com/Azure/bicep/issues/9990).
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Logs destination.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Application Insights connection string.
Optional. Application Insights connection string used by Dapr to export Service to Service communication telemetry.
Optional. Azure Monitor instrumentation key used by Dapr to export Service to Service communication telemetry.

Conditional. CIDR notation IP range assigned to the Docker bridge, network. It must not overlap with any other provided IP ranges and can only be used when the environment is deployed into a virtual network. If not provided, it will be set with a default value by the platform. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.

Conditional. Resource ID of a subnet for infrastructure components. This is used to deploy the environment into a virtual network. Must not overlap with any other provided IP ranges. Required if "internal" is set to true. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.

Conditional. Boolean indicating the environment only has an internal load balancer. These environments do not have a public static IP resource. If set to true, then "infrastructureSubnetId" must be provided. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.

Conditional. IP range in CIDR notation that can be reserved for environment infrastructure IP addresses. It must not overlap with any other provided IP ranges and can only be used when the environment is deployed into a virtual network. If not provided, it will be set with a default value by the platform. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true  to make the resource WAF compliant.

Conditional. An IP address from the IP range defined by "platformReservedCidr" that will be reserved for the internal DNS server. It must not be the first address in the range and can only be used when the environment is deployed into a virtual network. If not provided, it will be set with a default value by the platform. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.
Optional. Whether or not to encrypt peer traffic.
Optional. Whether or not this Managed Environment is zone-redundant.
Optional. Password of the certificate used by the custom domain.
Optional. Certificate to use for the custom domain. PFX or PEM.
Optional. DNS suffix for the environment domain.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Open Telemetry configuration.
Conditional. Workload profiles configured for the Managed Environment. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.
Conditional. Name of the infrastructure resource group. If not provided, it will be set with a default value. Required if zoneRedundant is set to true to make the resource WAF compliant.
Optional. The list of storages to mount on the environment.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned,UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', 'None')), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

properties.nfsAzureFile: [if(equals(coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].kind, 'NFS'), createObject('accessMode', coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].accessMode, 'server', format('{0}.file.{1}', coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].storageAccountName, environment().suffixes.storage), 'shareName', format('/{0}/{1}', coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].storageAccountName, coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].shareName)), null())]
properties.azureFile: [if(equals(coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].kind, 'SMB'), createObject('accessMode', coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].accessMode, 'accountName', coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].storageAccountName, 'accountKey', listkeys(resourceId('Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts', coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].storageAccountName), '2023-01-01').keys[0].value, 'shareName', coalesce(parameters('storages'), createArray())[copyIndex()].shareName), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Azure Container Registries (ACR)

Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.

Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.

Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.

Optional. The name of the scope map.
Required. The list of scoped permissions for registry artifacts.
Optional. The user friendly description of the scope map.
Required. Name of your Azure Container Registry.

Optional. Tier of your Azure container registry.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the export policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the quarantine policy is enabled or not. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the trust policy is enabled or not. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the retention policy is enabled or not.
Optional. The number of days to retain an untagged manifest after which it gets purged.
Optional. The value that indicates whether the policy for using ARM audience token for a container registr is enabled or not. Default is enabled.
Optional. Soft Delete policy status. Default is disabled.
Optional. The number of days after which a soft-deleted item is permanently deleted.
Optional. Enable a single data endpoint per region for serving data. Not relevant in case of disabled public access. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.

Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set and networkRuleSetIpRules are not set.  Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. Whether to allow trusted Azure services to access a network restricted registry.
Optional. The default action of allow or deny when no other rules match.
Optional. The IP ACL rules. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible. Note, requires the 'acrSku' to be 'Premium'.
Optional. Whether or not zone redundancy is enabled for this container registry.
Optional. All replications to create.
Optional. All webhooks to create.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. Enables registry-wide pull from unauthenticated clients. It's in preview and available in the Standard and Premium service tiers.

Optional. Array of Credential Sets.
Optional. Scope maps setting.

metadata.name: User Assigned Identity Federated Identity Credential
metadata.description: This module deploys a User Assigned Identity Federated Identity Credential.
Conditional. The name of the parent user assigned identity. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the secret.

Required. The list of audiences that can appear in the issued token. Should be set to api://AzureADTokenExchange for Azure AD. It says what Microsoft identity platform should accept in the aud claim in the incoming token. This value represents Azure AD in your external identity provider and has no fixed value across identity providers - you might need to create a new application registration in your IdP to serve as the audience of this token.
Required. The URL of the issuer to be trusted. Must match the issuer claim of the external token being exchanged.

Required. The identifier of the external software workload within the external identity provider. Like the audience value, it has no fixed format, as each IdP uses their own - sometimes a GUID, sometimes a colon delimited identifier, sometimes arbitrary strings. The value here must match the sub claim within the token presented to Azure AD.
The name of the federated identity credential.
The resource ID of the federated identity credential.
The name of the resource group the federated identity credential was created in.
The name of the user assigned identity.
The resource ID of the user assigned identity.
The principal ID (object ID) of the user assigned identity.
The client ID (application ID) of the user assigned identity.
The resource group the user assigned identity was deployed into.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Azd ACR Linked Container App
metadata.description:
Creates a container app in an Azure Container App environment.

**Note:** This module is not intended for broad, generic use, as it was designed to cater for the requirements of the AZD CLI product. Feature requests and bug fix requests are welcome if they support the development of the AZD CLI but may not be incorporated if they aim to make this module more generic than what it needs to be for its primary use case
Required. Environment variable name.
Optional. Name of the Container App secret from which to pull the environment variable value.
Optional. Non-secret environment variable value.
Optional. Host name to connect to. Defaults to the pod IP.
Optional. HTTP headers to set in the request.
Required. Path to access on the HTTP server.
Required. Name or number of the port to access on the container.
Optional. Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Defaults to HTTP.
The type for a container app probe HTTP GET.
Required. Name of the header.
Required. Value of the header.
The type for a container app probe HTTP GET header.
Optional. Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP.
Required. Number of the port to access on the container. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.
The type for a container app probe TCP socket.
Optional. Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3.
Optional. HTTPGet specifies the http request to perform.
Optional. Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness probes are initiated.
Optional. How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds.
Optional. Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness and startup.
Optional. The TCP socket specifies an action involving a TCP port. TCP hooks not yet supported.

Optional. Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully upon probe failure. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod's terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). This is an alpha field and requires enabling ProbeTerminationGracePeriod feature gate. Maximum value is 3600 seconds (1 hour).
Optional. Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Defaults to 1 second.
Optional. The type of probe.
The type for a container app probe.
Optional. Resource ID of a managed identity to authenticate with Azure Key Vault, or System to use a system-assigned identity.
Conditional. The URL of the Azure Key Vault secret referenced by the Container App. Required if `value` is null.
Optional. The name of the container app secret.
Conditional. The container app secret value, if not fetched from the Key Vault. Required if `keyVaultUrl` is not null.
The type for a secret.
Required. The name of the Container App.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Allowed origins.
Required. Name of the environment for container apps.
Optional. CPU cores allocated to a single container instance, e.g., 0.5.
Optional. The maximum number of replicas to run. Must be at least 1.
Optional. Memory allocated to a single container instance, e.g., 1Gi.
Optional. The minimum number of replicas to run. Must be at least 2.
Optional. The name of the container.
Optional. List of probes for the container.
Optional. The name of the container registry.
Optional. Hostname suffix for container registry. Set when deploying to sovereign clouds.
Optional. The protocol used by Dapr to connect to the app, e.g., http or grpc.
Optional. The Dapr app ID.
Optional. Enable Dapr.
Optional. The environment variables for the container.
Optional. Specifies if the resource ingress is exposed externally.
Optional. The name of the user-assigned identity.
Optional. The type of identity for the resource.
Optional. The name of the container image.
Optional. Specifies if Ingress is enabled for the container app.
Optional. Ingress transport protocol.
Optional. Rules to restrict incoming IP address.
Optional. Bool indicating if HTTP connections to is allowed. If set to false HTTP connections are automatically redirected to HTTPS connections.
Optional. Controls how active revisions are handled for the Container app.
Optional. The secrets required for the container.
Optional. The service binds associated with the container.
Optional. The name of the container apps add-on to use. e.g. redis.
Optional. The target port for the container.
Optional. Toggle to include the service configuration.
Optional. The principal ID of the principal to assign the role to.
Optional. The resource id of the user-assigned identity.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod's terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). Required. Name of the header.
Required. Value of the header.

Optional. Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP.
Required. Number of the port to access on the container. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.

Required. The maximum number of replicas.
Required. The minimum number of replicas.

Optional. The polling interval in seconds.
Optional. The scaling rules.

Optional. The custom scaling rule.
Optional. The Azure Queue based scaling rule.
Optional. The HTTP requests based scaling rule.
Optional. The TCP based scaling rule.
The scaling rules for the Container App.
Required. Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted.Must not contain ':'.

Required. This must match the Name of a Volume.
The type for a volume mount.
Optional. Resource ID of a managed identity to authenticate with Azure Key Vault, or System to use a system-assigned identity.
Conditional. The URL of the Azure Key Vault secret referenced by the Container App. Required if `value` is null.
Optional. The name of the container app secret.
Conditional. The container app secret value, if not fetched from the Key Vault. Required if `keyVaultUrl` is not null.
The type for a secret.
Optional. The configuration settings of the secrets references of encryption key and signing key for ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings that determines the validation flow of users using Service Authentication and/or Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings of the HTTP requests for authentication and authorization requests made against ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings of each of the identity providers used to configure ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings of the login flow of users using ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings of the platform of ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
The type for the container app's authentication configuration.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if only metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource. Required if a user assigned identity is used for encryption.
An AVM-aligned type for a managed identity configuration. To be used if both a system-assigned & user-assigned identities are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. Name of the Container App.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Bool to disable all ingress traffic for the container app.
Optional. Bool indicating if the App exposes an external HTTP endpoint.
Optional. Client certificate mode for mTLS.
Optional. Object userd to configure CORS policy.
Optional. Bool indicating if the Container App should enable session affinity.
Optional. Ingress transport protocol.
Optional. Dev ContainerApp service type.
Optional. Toggle to include the service configuration.
Optional. Settings to expose additional ports on container app.
Optional. Bool indicating if HTTP connections to is allowed. If set to false HTTP connections are automatically redirected to HTTPS connections.
Optional. Target Port in containers for traffic from ingress.
Optional. The scaling settings of the service.
Optional. List of container app services bound to the app.
Optional. Controls how active revisions are handled for the Container app.
Required. Resource ID of environment.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Collection of private container registry credentials for containers used by the Container app.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.

Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Custom domain bindings for Container App hostnames.
Optional. Exposed Port in containers for TCP traffic from ingress.
Optional. Rules to restrict incoming IP address.
Optional. Associates a traffic label with a revision. Label name should be consist of lower case alphanumeric characters or dashes.
Optional. Indicates that the traffic weight belongs to a latest stable revision.
Optional. Name of a revision.
Optional. Traffic weight assigned to a revision.
Optional. Dapr configuration for the Container App.
Optional. Settings for Managed Identities that are assigned to the Container App. If a Managed Identity is not specified here, default settings will be used.
Optional. Max inactive revisions a Container App can have.
Optional. Runtime configuration for the Container App.
Required. List of container definitions for the Container App.
Optional. List of specialized containers that run before app containers.
Optional. The secrets of the Container App.
Optional. User friendly suffix that is appended to the revision name.
Optional. List of volume definitions for the Container App.
Optional. Workload profile name to pin for container app execution.
Optional. The name of the Container App Auth configs.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned,UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', 'None')), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

configuration.ingress: [if(parameters('disableIngress'), null(), createObject('additionalPortMappings', parameters('additionalPortMappings'), 'allowInsecure', if(not(equals(parameters('ingressTransport'), 'tcp')), parameters('ingressAllowInsecure'), false()), 'customDomains', if(not(empty(parameters('customDomains'))), parameters('customDomains'), null()), 'corsPolicy', if(and(not(equals(parameters('corsPolicy'), null())), not(equals(parameters('ingressTransport'), 'tcp'))), createObject('allowCredentials', coalesce(tryGet(parameters('corsPolicy'), 'allowCredentials'), false()), 'allowedHeaders', coalesce(tryGet(parameters('corsPolicy'), 'allowedHeaders'), createArray()), 'allowedMethods', coalesce(tryGet(parameters('corsPolicy'), 'allowedMethods'), createArray()), 'allowedOrigins', coalesce(tryGet(parameters('corsPolicy'), 'allowedOrigins'), createArray()), 'exposeHeaders', coalesce(tryGet(parameters('corsPolicy'), 'exposeHeaders'), createArray()), 'maxAge', tryGet(parameters('corsPolicy'), 'maxAge')), null()), 'clientCertificateMode', if(not(equals(parameters('ingressTransport'), 'tcp')), parameters('clientCertificateMode'), null()), 'exposedPort', parameters('exposedPort'), 'external', parameters('ingressExternal'), 'ipSecurityRestrictions', if(not(empty(parameters('ipSecurityRestrictions'))), parameters('ipSecurityRestrictions'), null()), 'targetPort', parameters('ingressTargetPort'), 'stickySessions', createObject('affinity', parameters('stickySessionsAffinity')), 'traffic', if(not(equals(parameters('ingressTransport'), 'tcp')), createArray(createObject('label', parameters('trafficLabel'), 'latestRevision', parameters('trafficLatestRevision'), 'revisionName', parameters('trafficRevisionName'), 'weight', parameters('trafficWeight'))), null()), 'transport', parameters('ingressTransport')))]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]
